document_data.name: House of Uqab
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of Uqab''', also called the '''League of the Vulture''', was a tribe of loosely [[Zakharan pantheon|enlightened]] [[Al-Badia]] found in the [[High Desert]] of [[west Zakhara]] around [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p42">
document_data.Organization: Made up primarily of 2,500 outcasts of the desert, the House of Uqab considered themselves enlightened, but they held little respect for both the [[Khalil al-Assad al-Zahir|Grand Caliph]] and the Zakharan gods. Savages and other mountain tribes joined their ranks regularly. These individuals were often used on the front line of any attack to soften the enemy.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p42"/>
document_data.Activities: This tribe survived by raiding caravans and robbing others. They attacked any [[adventurer]]s in the desert without question.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p42"/>
document_data.Members: Sheikh [[Hanjar al-Haqara]] ruled the House of Uqab in 1367 DR.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p42"/>
document_data.Relationships: The more civilized tribes of the High Desert looked up the House of Uqab with disgust.<ref name=LoF:AGtZ-p42"/>
